svcproc.title: AIR SHIFT UNIT FOR THE INTER-AXLE DIFFERENTIAL LOCK

svcsubproc.title: Air Applied and Spring Release Models (Standard)

step1.para: Inspect the shift shaft for damage. Use an emery cloth to remove any small damage. If required, replace the shift shaft.
Put the spring and the shift fork in position in the carrier. The spring must touch the adjusting bolt side of the carrier. The boss on the fork must be toward the adjusting bolt.
Install the shift shaft so the smaller part of the shaft goes through the fork, the spring, and into the bore opposite the adjusting bolt.
If removed, install the O-ring on the piston. Apply the lubricant used in the axle housing to the O-ring. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Install the piston on the shift shaft.
On flange-type cylinders, apply silicone gasket material on the mounting surface of the cylinder. For silicone gasket materials, refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Install the cylinder. On flange-type cylinders, install and tighten the bolts to 7 to 12 ft-lbs. (10 to 16 Nm).
Install the adjusting bolt and the jam nut. Adjustment will be made after the input shaft assembly is installed.

svcsubproc.title: Spring Applied and Air Release Models (Optional)

figure.caption: Figure 99. Spring Applied and Air Release Models (Optional)

step1.para: Lubricate all the parts with the oil that is used in the axle. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Inspect the shift shaft for damage. Use an emery cloth to remove any small damage. If necessary, replace the shift shaft.
Install new O-rings in the groove in the shift shaft, in the groove in the shift cylinder and on the piston.
Lubricate the bore of the shift cylinder. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Install the piston into the shift cylinder.
Install the shift shaft into the piston and shift cylinder assembly.
Install the snap ring that fastens the piston on the shift shaft.
Install the spring in the piston bore.
Install the gasket so that the tab on the gasket is under the right bolt hole.
Install the cover. Install the bolts and the washers that fasten the cover to the cylinder.
Install the assembly in the carrier so that the shift shaft is in the bore of the shift fork.
Install the bolts and the washers that fasten the assembly to the carrier. Tighten to 7 to 12 ft-lbs. (10 to 16 Nm).
Install the adjusting bolt and the jam nut. Adjustment will be made after the input shaft is installed.
